definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to tumble/to fall/fig. to suffer a reverse (in politics or business)
daily lower limit on the price of a stock
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
drop of height in waterway/staircase of waterfalls

sentences.english: He slipped and broke his leg during the big freeze last winter.
sentences.chinese: 寒期間他滑了一跤，跌斷了腿。

sentences.english: He dashed the bowl to bits on a rock.
sentences.chinese: 他把碗跌在岩石上摔得粉碎。

sentences.english: He lost hold of the horse and fell off.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有抓好馬而跌了下去。

sentences.english: The only president not to parade down Pennsylvania Avenue was Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的總統不跌賓夕法尼亞大道的遊行是羅納德里根。

sentences.english: I want take away the book which you showed me yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我想跌走匿昨添給我看的那本碎。

sentences.english: To her horror, she saw him fall.
sentences.chinese: 她看見他跌下驚恐萬狀。

sentences.english: Mittens laughed so that she fell off the wall.
sentences.chinese: 密騰笑到從牆上跌了下來。

sentences.english: She fell down the stairs and hurt her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她從樓上跌了下來，摔傷了腿。

sentences.english: He lost his balance, and pitched out of the window headfirst.
sentences.chinese: 他失去平衡，頭朝下從窗子上跌了下去。

sentences.english: Overall, British prices have only fallen about 12% from the peak.
sentences.chinese: 總體而言，英國房價僅比峯值時下跌了12%左右。

sentences.english: He spilt out of the tree, and broke his leg.
sentences.chinese: 他從樹上跌了下來，摔斷了腿。

sentences.english: The price of houses is not likely to fall below the present level for some time to come.
sentences.chinese: 房價一時不見得會跌到目前的價格以下。

sentences.english: What shapeless lump is that, bent, crouch'd there on the sand?
sentences.chinese: 那在沙上彎着腰，抱頭跌坐的一大堆是什麼？

sentences.english: The sharp sell -off in the final hour of trading sent the stocks tumbling Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 收盤前一個小時的急跌使得週四股市大幅低收。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
(of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
